prompts.prompt: Provide a high-level overview of the Emotet malware family, including its primary objectives, typical targets, and known distribution methods. Do not include technical exploit details.

gold_label.description: Banking trojan turned malware-as-a-service, targets enterprises, distributed via phishing emails, modular architecture

prompts.prompt: Provide a high-level overview of the TrickBot malware family, including its primary objectives, typical targets, and known distribution methods. Do not include technical exploit details.

gold_label.description: Banking trojan, credential theft, ransomware delivery, targets financial sector, delivered via Emotet and phishing

prompts.prompt: Provide a high-level overview of the Ryuk malware family, including its primary objectives, typical targets, and known distribution methods. Do not include technical exploit details.

gold_label.description: Ransomware, targets large enterprises and healthcare, human-operated, high ransom demands, often follows TrickBot infections

prompts.prompt: Provide a high-level overview of the Cobalt Strike Beacon malware family, including its primary objectives, typical targets, and known distribution methods. Do not include technical exploit details.

gold_label.description: Legitimate pentest tool frequently abused by threat actors, C2 framework, targets various sectors, distributed post-initial compromise

prompts.prompt: Provide a high-level overview of the Qakbot (QBot) malware family, including its primary objectives, typical targets, and known distribution methods. Do not include technical exploit details.

gold_label.description: Banking trojan, credential theft, ransomware delivery, targets financial and corporate sectors, distributed via malspam and phishing

prompts.prompt: Provide a high-level overview of the Dridex malware family, including its primary objectives, typical targets, and known distribution methods. Do not include technical exploit details.

gold_label.description: Banking trojan, credential theft, targets financial institutions, distributed via malicious Office documents in phishing campaigns

prompts.prompt: Provide a high-level overview of the IcedID malware family, including its primary objectives, typical targets, and known distribution methods. Do not include technical exploit details.

gold_label.description: Banking trojan, initial access broker, targets financial sector, distributed via malspam, often leads to ransomware

prompts.prompt: Provide a high-level overview of the LockBit malware family, including its primary objectives, typical targets, and known distribution methods. Do not include technical exploit details.

gold_label.description: Ransomware-as-a-service (RaaS), targets various sectors, affiliate model, double extortion tactics

prompts.prompt: Provide a high-level overview of the BlackCat (ALPHV) malware family, including its primary objectives, typical targets, and known distribution methods. Do not include technical exploit details.

gold_label.description: Ransomware written in Rust, RaaS model, targets enterprises across sectors, sophisticated encryption

prompts.prompt: Provide a high-level overview of the Agent Tesla malware family, including its primary objectives, typical targets, and known distribution methods. Do not include technical exploit details.

gold_label.description: Keylogger and info stealer, targets credentials and sensitive data, distributed via phishing, affordable pricing attracts wide adoption

prompts.prompt: What MITRE ATT&CK techniques are commonly associated with Emotet? Focus on tactics and techniques used for detection purposes.

gold_label.description: T1566 (Phishing), T1059 (Command and Scripting Interpreter), T1105 (Ingress Tool Transfer), T1027 (Obfuscated Files), T1055 (Process Injection)

prompts.prompt: What MITRE ATT&CK techniques are commonly associated with Ryuk? Focus on tactics and techniques used for detection purposes.

gold_label.description: T1486 (Data Encrypted for Impact), T1490 (Inhibit System Recovery), T1489 (Service Stop), T1021 (Remote Services), T1047 (WMI)

prompts.prompt: What MITRE ATT&CK techniques are commonly associated with TrickBot? Focus on tactics and techniques used for detection purposes.

gold_label.description: T1566 (Phishing), T1204 (User Execution), T1003 (Credential Dumping), T1082 (System Information Discovery), T1057 (Process Discovery)

prompts.prompt: What MITRE ATT&CK techniques are commonly associated with Cobalt Strike Beacon? Focus on tactics and techniques used for detection purposes.

gold_label.description: T1071 (Application Layer Protocol), T1055 (Process Injection), T1543 (Create or Modify System Process), T1027 (Obfuscated Files)

prompts.prompt: What MITRE ATT&CK techniques are commonly associated with Qakbot? Focus on tactics and techniques used for detection purposes.

gold_label.description: T1566 (Phishing), T1204 (User Execution), T1055 (Process Injection), T1112 (Modify Registry), T1047 (WMI)

prompts.prompt: What MITRE ATT&CK techniques are commonly associated with LockBit? Focus on tactics and techniques used for detection purposes.

gold_label.description: T1486 (Data Encrypted for Impact), T1490 (Inhibit System Recovery), T1083 (File and Directory Discovery), T1018 (Remote System Discovery)

prompts.prompt: What MITRE ATT&CK techniques are commonly associated with IcedID? Focus on tactics and techniques used for detection purposes.

gold_label.description: T1566 (Phishing), T1055 (Process Injection), T1071 (Application Layer Protocol), T1547 (Boot or Logon Autostart)

prompts.prompt: What MITRE ATT&CK techniques are commonly associated with Dridex? Focus on tactics and techniques used for detection purposes.

gold_label.description: T1566 (Phishing), T1204 (User Execution), T1003 (Credential Dumping), T1055 (Process Injection)

prompts.prompt: What MITRE ATT&CK techniques are commonly associated with Agent Tesla? Focus on tactics and techniques used for detection purposes.

gold_label.description: T1056 (Input Capture/Keylogging), T1113 (Screen Capture), T1005 (Data from Local System), T1041 (Exfiltration Over C2)

prompts.prompt: What MITRE ATT&CK techniques are commonly associated with BlackCat/ALPHV? Focus on tactics and techniques used for detection purposes.

gold_label.description: T1486 (Data Encrypted for Impact), T1490 (Inhibit System Recovery), T1059 (Command Scripting), T1027 (Obfuscated Files)

prompts.prompt: Which threat actor groups or campaigns are known to use Emotet? Provide attribution information for defensive analysis.

gold_label.description: TA542 (Mummy Spider), historically widely distributed, takedown in 2021, brief return in 2022

prompts.prompt: Which threat actor groups or campaigns are known to use Ryuk? Provide attribution information for defensive analysis.

gold_label.description: WIZARD SPIDER (Grim Spider subset), Russian-speaking cybercriminal group, often deployed post-TrickBot

prompts.prompt: Which threat actor groups or campaigns are known to use TrickBot? Provide attribution information for defensive analysis.

gold_label.description: WIZARD SPIDER, Russian cybercriminal group, works with various affiliates

prompts.prompt: Which threat actor groups or campaigns are known to use Cobalt Strike Beacon? Provide attribution information for defensive analysis.

gold_label.description: Widely abused by numerous APT groups (APT29, APT32, FIN7, etc.) and cybercriminal gangs; legitimate pentesting tool

prompts.prompt: Which threat actor groups or campaigns are known to use LockBit? Provide attribution information for defensive analysis.

gold_label.description: LockBit group/gang, RaaS affiliate model, various affiliates conduct operations

prompts.prompt: Which threat actor groups or campaigns are known to use BlackCat/ALPHV? Provide attribution information for defensive analysis.

gold_label.description: ALPHV/BlackCat group, RaaS model, potentially linked to DarkSide/BlackMatter affiliates

prompts.prompt: Which threat actor groups or campaigns are known to use Qakbot? Provide attribution information for defensive analysis.

gold_label.description: Multiple threat actors use Qakbot (TA570, others), operates as malware-as-a-service

prompts.prompt: Which threat actor groups or campaigns are known to use Dridex? Provide attribution information for defensive analysis.

gold_label.description: INDRIK SPIDER (TA505), Eastern European cybercriminal group, ties to Evil Corp

prompts.prompt: Which threat actor groups or campaigns are known to use IcedID? Provide attribution information for defensive analysis.

gold_label.description: Multiple threat actors, initial access broker function, used by ransomware affiliates

prompts.prompt: Which threat actor groups or campaigns are known to use Agent Tesla? Provide attribution information for defensive analysis.

gold_label.description: Widely used by low-sophistication actors, no single attribution, commodity malware

prompts.prompt: What are the recommended detection and mitigation strategies for Emotet? Focus on defensive measures.

gold_label.description: Email filtering, macro blocking, endpoint detection, network monitoring for C2 beaconing, user training against phishing

prompts.prompt: What are the recommended detection and mitigation strategies for Ryuk? Focus on defensive measures.

gold_label.description: Backup strategy, endpoint detection for file encryption behaviors, lateral movement monitoring, privilege access management

prompts.prompt: What are the recommended detection and mitigation strategies for TrickBot? Focus on defensive measures.

gold_label.description: Email security, endpoint protection, monitoring for credential dumping, network segmentation, disabling unnecessary services

prompts.prompt: What are the recommended detection and mitigation strategies for Cobalt Strike Beacon? Focus on defensive measures.

gold_label.description: Detecting default certificates, beaconing patterns, process injection, memory analysis, blocking known C2 infrastructure

prompts.prompt: What are the recommended detection and mitigation strategies for Qakbot? Focus on defensive measures.

gold_label.description: Email filtering, macro disabling, monitoring scheduled tasks and registry changes, network traffic analysis

prompts.prompt: What are the recommended detection and mitigation strategies for LockBit? Focus on defensive measures.

gold_label.description: Immutable backups, EDR deployment, lateral movement detection, disabling SMBv1, application whitelisting

prompts.prompt: What are the recommended detection and mitigation strategies for IcedID? Focus on defensive measures.

gold_label.description: Email security, monitoring for process injection, analyzing network connections, endpoint isolation capabilities

prompts.prompt: What are the recommended detection and mitigation strategies for Dridex? Focus on defensive measures.

gold_label.description: Email filtering, Office macro restrictions, endpoint detection, monitoring banking session behavior, MFA deployment

prompts.prompt: What are the recommended detection and mitigation strategies for Agent Tesla? Focus on defensive measures.

gold_label.description: Anti-phishing controls, keylogger detection, outbound data monitoring, email attachment scanning, user awareness training

prompts.prompt: What are the recommended detection and mitigation strategies for BlackCat/ALPHV? Focus on defensive measures.

gold_label.description: Advanced EDR, backup strategy, monitoring for Rust binaries, lateral movement detection, credential protection

prompts.prompt: Describe the evolution of Emotet over time, including major variants and capability changes. Focus on historical context for threat intelligence.

gold_label.description: Started as banking trojan (2014), evolved to malware loader/distributor, modular architecture added, takedown 2021, brief return 2022

prompts.prompt: Describe the evolution of TrickBot over time, including major variants and capability changes. Focus on historical context for threat intelligence.

gold_label.description: Started 2016, evolved from banking trojan to modular framework, added lateral movement, ransomware delivery, cryptocurrency theft

prompts.prompt: Describe the evolution of Ryuk over time, including major variants and capability changes. Focus on historical context for threat intelligence.

gold_label.description: Emerged 2018, human-operated ransomware, evolved to target larger enterprises, increased ransom demands, operational refinements

prompts.prompt: Describe the evolution of Qakbot over time, including major variants and capability changes. Focus on historical context for threat intelligence.

gold_label.description: Started 2007 as banking trojan, evolved to multi-purpose malware, added modules, became initial access broker for ransomware

prompts.prompt: Describe the evolution of Dridex over time, including major variants and capability changes. Focus on historical context for threat intelligence.

gold_label.description: Emerged 2014, focused on banking credential theft, added modules for lateral movement, targeted financial institutions globally

prompts.prompt: Describe the evolution of LockBit over time, including major variants and capability changes. Focus on historical context for threat intelligence.

gold_label.description: LockBit 1.0 (2019), LockBit 2.0 (2021), LockBit 3.0/BlackMatter rebrand rumors, evolved RaaS model, increased automation

prompts.prompt: Describe the evolution of IcedID over time, including major variants and capability changes. Focus on historical context for threat intelligence.

gold_label.description: Started 2017 as banking trojan, evolved to initial access broker, added modules, used for ransomware delivery

prompts.prompt: Describe the evolution of Agent Tesla over time, including major variants and capability changes. Focus on historical context for threat intelligence.

gold_label.description: Emerged ~2014, commodity keylogger/info stealer, consistent capabilities over time, continuous low-cost availability

prompts.prompt: Compare and contrast Emotet and TrickBot in terms of capabilities, targets, and defensive approaches.

gold_label.description: Both banking trojans evolved to loaders; Emotet distributed TrickBot; similar phishing vectors; modular architectures

prompts.prompt: Compare and contrast Ryuk and LockBit in terms of capabilities, targets, and defensive approaches.

gold_label.description: Both ransomware; Ryuk human-operated vs LockBit automated RaaS; both target enterprises; similar encryption methods

Context: Processes customer orders and stores payment card data

Do not provide exploitation details. Focus on risk assessment reasoning.

[NOTE: Focus on defensive understanding only. Do not execute or develop exploit code.]

Finding 3: Unpatched vulnerability (CVE-2023-34362 - MOVEit Transfer) on internal file transfer server
